clinical_study.official_title: The Burden of COVID-19 Survivorship: Exercise Therapy to Combat the Sequelae of COVID-19

brief_summary.textblock: This research study is being done to find out what the longer-term physiological consequences of COVID-19 are, and to determine if exercise therapy can help improve lung function, heart function and overall fitness, and reduce symptoms in people recovering from SARS-CoV-2.

detailed_description.textblock: The purpose of this research is to see if taking part in structured exercise training will improve the ability to exercise, the function of the lungs and the function of the heart, and reduce symptoms of fatigue and breathlessness in people recovering from COVID-19. After enrollment all patients will complete exercise testing, lung function testing, and cardiac imaging. Patients will be randomized to either 8 weeks of exercise training (4-5 times per week) or will continue standard medical care. All patients will undergo detailed exercise testing, lung function testing, and cardiac imaging after the intervention.

primary_outcome.measure: Maximal oxygen update (VO2max) measured in mL/kg/min
primary_outcome.description: VO2max is the maximal oxygen consumed during an exhaustive exercise test

secondary_outcome.measure: Peak exercise work rate (Wpeak) measured in Watts
secondary_outcome.description: Wpeak is the highest achieved power during a maximal incremental cycle exercise test

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced vital capacity (FVC) measured in L
secondary_outcome.description: FVC is the largest amount of air that can be exhaled from the lungs in one maximal breath

secondary_outcome.measure: Forced expiratory volume in 1 second (FEV1) measured in L
secondary_outcome.description: FEV1 is the largest amount of air that can be exhaled from the lungs in the first second of one maximal breath

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximal inspiratory pressure (MIP) measured in cmH2O
secondary_outcome.description: Highest inspiratory muscle pressure (i.e. inspiratory muscle strength) during a maximal inspiratory effort

secondary_outcome.measure: Maximal expiratory pressure (MEP) measured in cmH2O
secondary_outcome.description: Highest expiratory muscle pressure (i.e. expiratory muscle strength) during a maximal expiratory effort

secondary_outcome.measure: Left ventricular contractile function measured as % fractional area change (LV FAC)
secondary_outcome.description: LV FAC is a measure of overall contractile function of the LV

secondary_outcome.measure: Right ventricular contractile function measured as % fractional area change (RV FAC)
secondary_outcome.description: RV FAC is a measure of overall contractile function of the RV

arm_group.description: Standard physician-guided medical care after COVID-19

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Aged 21 to 75 years.
- History of RT-PCR proven SARS-CoV-2 infection.
- Deemed 'recovered' from SARS-CoV-2 infection.
- Not clinically obese (BMI â‰¥ 36) and/or suffer from musculoskeletal or other conditions that would limit exercise participation.
- No evidence of cardiac ischemia at rest or during exertion (via ECG).
- Able to provide written informed consent.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Individuals less than 21 or more than 75 years old.
- Not able to take part in structured exercise training due to injury or other conditions that would put person at risk during exercise.
- Unable to provide written informed consent.
